value.title: Age Calculation in Power BI using Power Query
value.excerpt: Power Query has a simple way of calculating the age. However, because DAX is the popular language in many calculations in Power BI, many are not aware of this function in Power Query. In this video, I am going to show you how easy is to calculate Age in Power BI using Power BI. This method is very useful
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/a4kPkOAYOvg" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Aggregated Table in Power BI   Using GroupBy Function in DAX
value.excerpt: There are many different ways you can create aggregations in Power BI, You can do it in the source (using the database t-SQL language), or using Group By operation in Power Query. You can also do it in DAX using some functions. One of the functions that can be used for grouping and aggregation is Group
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/IWJn2jVyb2o" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Aggregated Table in Power BI with Extra Options   Summarize Function in DAX
value.excerpt: In the previous video, I explained how you can use GROUPBY function in DAX to create an aggregated table. In this video, I'll explain how you can use Summarize function for the same purpose. Summarize function gives you more control on how to create your aggregated table with some extra functions. Let's
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/6Lvy4S_EnAY" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Combining Tables in Power BI   Union Except and Intersect in DAX
value.excerpt: Power Query is often the engine used for combining data tables, especially using Merge or Append. However, sometimes, you might need to do that operation in DAX. An example of that is when you want to create that combination only virtually as part of a measure calculation that evaluates dynamically.

value.title: Custom Functions Made Easy in Power BI

value.title: Get the Day of the Week Name and Number in Power BI Using DAX
value.excerpt: If you don't have a date table with a column that represents the day of the week name (Saturday, Sunday, Monday etc) or number (from zero to six, or from one to seven), and you just have a date field, which you want to quickly get the day name of the week, here is a quick trick for you. Read my blog

value.title: How to organize workspaces in a Power BI environment
value.excerpt: The question I often get in my Power BI architecture consulting sessions is that; “How should we organize our workspaces? should we have one workspace with all the reports in it? or multiple? should we split it based on each report? business unit? or something else?” In this article and video, I’ll explain

value.title: Performance Tip for Power BI Enable Load Sucks Memory Up
value.excerpt: In the area of performance tuning a Power BI model, many things have to be considered, most of them around the consumption of the CPU and RAM. One of the most basic but important consideration is minimizing the usage of memory. By default, all queries from Query Editor will be loaded into the memory

value.title: Remove Digits or Keep them in Power BI Using Power Query
value.excerpt: There are a couple of useful actions that help a lot in cleaning data; removing digits, or keeping digits and removing everything else. In this short video, I’ll explain a simple method to do that using Power Query. Codes are in my blog article here: https://radacad.com/remove-digits-or-keep-them-in-power-bi-using-power-query

value.title: Removing the Total Value for a Column in the Table Visual of Power BI Using ISFILTERED
value.excerpt: Table visual is one of the most commonly used visuals. In Power BI, you can turn off the total row (when it won’t make sense to have the total) entirely. However, you cannot turn off the total for some columns and keep it working for the others. Using a DAX function, you can, however, do this easily.

value.title: Share Different Visual Pages with Different Security Groups in Power BI
value.excerpt: I have written a dozen of blogs and a book about Power BI row-level security and the security on the dataset. value.title: Computing a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: You can use DAX Studio to evaluate one or more measures in your data model. This is the first step to write, test, and debug your DAX measures in a productive manner.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870

value.title: Create Static Tables in DAX Using the DATATABLE Function
value.excerpt: The DATATABLE function can create static tables in a Power BI model specifying column names and data types.
